Instance.description: Class that manages a career event.

Tunable.name: cooldown
Tunable.description: How many work days before this career event will be offered again.

TunableVariant.name: end_of_day_reports
TunableVariant.description: This is the end of shift performance report for an active career. This will be built using a string from each of the Sims that happens to be in the same active career event that are ending their shift at the same time. A header will be displayed along with a bulleted list of the performance of each Sim.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The data used to form the end of career event performance string. This will show for all sims in an active career event that matches this career event and ending at the same time.

TunableVariant.name: header_string
TunableVariant.description: When enabled a header string will appear above the performance strings. This is not the same as the Title of the Notification which appears at the top of the notification that appears.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The string to act as the header to the performance string. This won't change at all based on the Sim, it will just be a summary for what the report means.

TunableVariant.name: leave_early_notification
TunableVariant.description: Optional alternate version of the notification for when the sim leaves early.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The tuning for the notification that shows up when a sim leaves early. Uses a single sim resolver, with the sim leaving early as the sim, so if no tokens are specified the first token is the sim. Also has the string that contains the performance bullet points as am additional token, e.g. The performance bullet points and header, (should you choose to include them) will be {1.String}. (This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Notification tuning snippet.)

TunableTuple.description: A dialog that is displayed as a notification.

TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: DEPRECATED! Please use custom_mask_target_sim instead. Use InGame/UI/Icons/Dialog/phone_anonymous_caller_icon.png and UI/Gameplay/Phone:UnknownCallerName. If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description: If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block. ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description: If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not. If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played. ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this will set the owner of the audio sting when the dialog is shown.

TunableList.name: performance_strings
TunableList.description: A List of tests and localized strings. The string associated with the first test that passes for the Sim in the career event will be added to the end of day reports to show the result of that Sim. Token 0 is the Sim whose performance you are reporting.

TunableTuple.description: A pair of tests and a localized string. If the tests pass then the localized string will be added to the performance string.

Tunable.name: individual_string
Tunable.description: The performance string for the Sim for today's shift in an active career.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests must pass for the asscoiated string to be shown. The tests run with Actor as the Sim who is currently in the career event being tested.

Tunable.name: loot_on_request
Tunable.description: Loot applied when the career event is requested to start. Happens before traveling. Example 1: A detective is at home and goes to work. This loot applies while the detective is still on the home lot, right before the travel to the police station happens. Example 2: A detective at the police station travels to a crime scene. This loot for the crime scene sub event applies while the detective is still at the police station, right before the travel.

Tunable.name: loot_on_start
Tunable.description: Loot applied when the career event starts. Happens after travel. Example 1: A detective is at home and goes to work. This loot applies at the police station, right after traveling. Example 2: A detective at the police station travels to a crime scene. This loot for the crime scene sub event applies at the crime scene lot, right after traveling.

TunableList.name: loots_on_cleanup
TunableList.description: Loots that are applied after the career event has been completely shut down. Not the same as loot on end which is processed while shutting down. Loot on cleanup will happen after the loot on end.

Tunable.description: A loot applied on cleanup of the career event.

TunableList.name: loots_on_end
TunableList.description: Loots applied when the career event ends.

Tunable.description: A loot applied when the career event ends.

TunableVariant.name: required_zone
TunableVariant.description: The required zone for this career event (e.g. the hospital lot for a doctor career event). The Sim involved in this event will automatically travel to this zone at the beginning of the work shift. The Sim will in general be prohibited from leaving this zone without work -- the lone exception is the Sim is allowed to travel for a career sub-event (e.g. a detective Sim running a career event requiring the police station lot is allowed to initiate the sub- event of investigating the crime scene at a commercial lot).

TunableTuple.name: any
TunableTuple.description: No required career event zone.

TunableTuple.name: career_customer_lot
TunableTuple.description: Require career event zone to be the Customer's household for the tuned Career.

Tunable.name: career
Tunable.description: The career used to look up the client's lot.

TunableTuple.name: home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Require career event zone to be the Sim's home zone.

TunableTuple.name: lot_description
TunableTuple.description: Specify the required career event zone by lot description.

TunableVariant.name: house_description
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, this house description will be used for this career event. For example, for the acting career loads into the same lot but different houses (studio sets).

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: House description used for this career event.

Tunable.name: lot_description
Tunable.description: Lot description of required zone.

TunableTuple.name: random_lot
TunableTuple.description: Travel to a random zone, with weighting according to the tuning.

TunableVariant.name: household_weighting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, and a household lives in the zone, calculated weight will be multiplied by the 0-1 score returned by a household sim filter tested against the household.

Tunable.name: blacklist_filter
Tunable.description: Specifies the blacklist filter for the household filter. Uses 1- score of highest scoring sim in household using this filter to modify the calculated base score. If highest score is 1, then the weight modifier will be 0 and zone will be ineligible.

Tunable.name: primary_filter
Tunable.description: Filter used to determine the base score of the household using the sim that scores the highest. If Highest score is 0, then the weight modifier will be 0, and zone will be ineligible.

TunableList.name: random_weight_terms
TunableList.description: A list of tests to use and the weights to add for each test. By default, zones start with a weight of 1.0 and this can be increased through these tests.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, extra weight will be applied to zones that do NOT pass this test, instead of zones that do pass.

TunableTuple.name: belongs_to_active_player
TunableTuple.description: A zone test to check if the zone belongs to the active player.

TunableTuple.name: has_zone_modifiers
TunableTuple.description: A zone test for a specific modifier on the zone.

TunableList.name: blacklist_zone_modifiers
TunableList.description: A zone cannot have the selected number of modifiers to pass this test.

Tunable.name: num_blacklist_allowed
Tunable.description: The threshold of blacklist modifiers owned by the zone that will trigger a test failure.

Tunable.name: num_whitelist_required
Tunable.description: The number of whitelist modifiers that the zone is required to have in order to pass this test.

TunableList.name: whitelist_zone_modifiers
TunableList.description: A zone must have the selected number of these modifiers to pass this test..

TunableTuple.name: is_active_zone
TunableTuple.description: A zone test to check if the zone is currently the active zone.

TunableTuple.name: is_npc_household
TunableTuple.description: A zone test to check if the zone belongs to an NPC household.

TunableTuple.name: is_owned_by_any_household
TunableTuple.description: A zone test to check if the zone is owned by any household.

TunableTuple.name: is_plex
TunableTuple.description: A zone test to check if the zone is a plex.

TunableTuple.name: venue_type
TunableTuple.description: A zone test for a specific list of venue types.

TunableList.name: venues
TunableList.description: If the venue is in this list, the test passes.

Tunable.name: add_weight
Tunable.description: The amount of extra weight to add to the probability of zones that pass this test.

TunableVariant.name: scorable_situation
TunableVariant.description: A situation which the player must complete. Work performance for the Sim will depend on how much the Sim accomplishes. This should be enabled for main events and disabled for sub events. Example: Detective Career. The career event that starts at the beginning of the work shift, going to the police station, will have a scorable situation. The sub event to go to the crime scene will not, as the career event will not be scored against it.

TunableTuple.name: medal_payout_bronze
TunableTuple.description: Work performance and money payout if scorable situation ends with a bronze medal.

TunableList.name: additional_loots
TunableList.description: Any additional loot needed on this medal payout. Currently, this is used to award additional drama nodes/dialogs on this level.

Tunable.description: The loot action applied.

TunableTuple.name: money
TunableTuple.description: Multiplier on full day pay, determined by hourly wage (tunable at Career Level -> Simoleons Per Hour), multiplied by work day length (tunable at Career Level -> Work Scheduler), modified by any additional multipliers (e.g. tuning on Career Level -> Simolean Trait Bonus, Career Track -> Overmax, etc.).

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: text
Tunable.description: Text shown at end of event notification/dialog if the Sim finishes at this medal. 0 param - Sim in the career

Tunable.name: situation
Tunable.description: Situation which the Sim in the career event will be scored by.

TunableVariant.name: subvenue
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the zones venue will be changed to the specified subvenue at the start of the event, and returned to the primary venue at the end of the event. Returning to the primary venue at the end of the event will occur immediately if the zone is not currently the active zone, otherwise it will will be delayed by the specified time in order to give the player time to leave the lot prior to being hit by the venue change loadscreen.

TunableTuple.name: delay
TunableTuple.description: How long to delay the restoration to the default venue type as long as the zone remains active.

Tunable.name: days
Tunable.description: Number of days

Tunable.name: hours
Tunable.description: Number of hours

Tunable.name: minutes
Tunable.description: Number of minutes

Tunable.name: venue
Tunable.description: The subvenue to change to.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests for if this career event is available to the Sim ParticipantType.Actor.

TunableVariant.name: zone_director
TunableVariant.description: An optional zone director to apply to the zone the career event takes place.
